text: Sledging biscuits are hard, long-live biscuits made of flour, salt, butter, water and baking soda. Sladging biscuits are popular on expeditions in Antarctica because they are high in energy. Sledging biscuits can be served with butter, marmite or cheese. Hoosh is a stew made of sledging biscuits, pemmican and water. == References == Category:Biscuits
title: Sledging biscuits
